properties.name: Great Wall of China (Mutianyu)
properties.description: 13,000-mile ancient wonder snaking across mountains, UNESCO World Heritage and New 7 Wonders

properties.name: Terracotta Warriors
properties.description: 8,000 life-sized clay soldiers guarding Emperor Qin's tomb, discovered 1974 (UNESCO)

properties.name: Zhangjiajie National Forest Park
properties.description: Towering sandstone pillars that inspired Avatar's floating mountains (UNESCO)

properties.name: Forbidden City
properties.description: World's largest palace complex with 980 buildings, home to 24 emperors (UNESCO)

properties.name: Li River (Guilin to Yangshuo)
properties.description: Dramatic karst limestone peaks rising from emerald waters, quintessential Chinese landscape

properties.name: The Bund (Shanghai)
properties.description: Iconic waterfront promenade with Art Deco buildings facing Pudong's futuristic skyline

properties.name: Giant Buddha of Leshan
properties.description: World's largest stone Buddha at 71m, carved into cliff face in the 8th century (UNESCO)

properties.name: Jiuzhaigou Valley
properties.description: Fairytale valley of turquoise lakes, waterfalls, and snow-capped peaks (UNESCO)

properties.name: Yellow Mountains (Huangshan)
properties.description: Mist-shrouded granite peaks with twisted pine trees, inspiration for Chinese landscape art (UNESCO)

properties.name: Potala Palace
properties.description: Towering 13-story winter palace of the Dalai Lamas in Lhasa, Tibet (UNESCO)
